parts.questionText: Expand and simplify $2a-3(a+5b)$.
Factorise completely $-3x^{2}+12y^{2}$.
Calculate $\frac{5048.9^{2}-30140}{14.69+9.656}$. Write your answer correct to 5 significant figures.
Write your answer to part (a) in standard form.

questions.stem: Given that $\sin\theta=0.4$, find the two possible values for angle $\theta$, where $0^{\circ}\le\theta\le180^{\circ}$.

parts.questionText: Find the two possible values for angle $\theta$.

questions.title: Trigonometric Angle Solutions

questions.stem: A stack of coloured paper contains green, purple and blue sheets of paper. A piece of paper is selected at random from the stack.

parts.questionText: The probability that the paper is green is 10%. The probability that the paper is purple is $\frac{7}{20}$. Find the probability that the paper is blue.

A few pieces of green paper were added to the stack. The probability of picking a piece of purple paper from this stack at random is now $\frac{1}{3}$. If there were 120 sheets of paper initially, find the new probability of picking a blue piece of paper.

questions.title: Probability of Coloured Paper

parts.questionText: Find the median of the set of numbers.
Find the range of the set of numbers.
Simplify $\frac{(-2q)^{4}}{6\sqrt{p^{5}}}\times\frac{3\sqrt{p}}{-q}$. Leave your answer in positive index notation.

questions.stem: The cost of a pen is $a. The cost of a marker is $b. Amelia buys 5 pens and 3 markers for $11.90. Benny buys 8 pens and 2 markers for $14.

parts.questionText: Form and solve two simultaneous equations to find the cost of a pen and the cost of a marker.

questions.title: Simultaneous Equations Word Problem

questions.stem: 264 1-cm cubes are to be arranged to form a cuboid. Only one length of the cuboid is a prime number.

parts.questionText: Find a possible set of dimensions of the cuboid.

questions.title: Factors and Cuboid Dimensions

questions.stem: A model of a school is made. The actual floor area of the school field is 4050 square metres.

parts.questionText: On the model, the area of the school field is $20~cm^{2}$. Find the scale of the model in the form $1:n,$ where n is correct to two significant figures.
The scale on another model is 1: 4000. Find the area of the school field on this model.

questions.title: Map Scale and Area

questions.stem:
The table shows the heights of 50 students, measured in January 2023.

| Heights, h cm | Frequency |
| :--- | :--- |
| $130\le h<140$ | 1 |
| $140\le h<150$ | 4 |
| $150\le h<160$ | 16 |
| $160\le h<170$ | 27 |
| $170\le h<180$ | 2 |

parts.questionText: Calculate an estimate for the mean height of the students,
Calculate an estimate for the standard deviation of the heights.

The heights of the same group of students were measured again in January 2024. The shortest height measured was 146 cm. The tallest height measured was 180 cm. State how the mean and standard deviation will change in January 2024.

questions.title: Statistics Heights

parts.questionText: Find x.
Factorise $10x^{2}+11x-6$.

questions.stem: Jade has a sum of money in her bank account. She gives half of it to her mother and uses $150. She receives $500 on her pay day into the bank account. She then uses 20% of the amount in her bank account and is left with not more than $800.

parts.questionText: By using x to represent the original sum of money in Jade's bank account, write down an inequality in x.
Solve your inequality to find the largest possible value of x.

questions.title: Inequality Word Problem

parts.questionText: Rearrange the formula to make x the subject.
Write as a single fraction in its simplest form $\frac{6x}{18x-3}-\frac{1}{1-6x}.$

questions.stem: On Monday, a car travelling from work to home at an average speed of p $km/h$ takes 30 minutes to complete the journey. On Tuesday, the car decreased its average speed by q% and took 45 minutes instead to complete the same journey.

parts.questionText: Find the value of q.

questions.title: Speed, Time and Percentage

questions.stem: Gwee is making cookies and brownies. A single chocolate cookie requires 14g of sugar, 10g of butter and 10g of chocolate. A slice of brownie requires 30g of sugar, 19g of butter and 25g of chocolate. This information can be represented by the matrix $A=(\begin{matrix}14&10&10\\ 30&19&25\end{matrix})$. Gwee wants to make x cookies and 20 brownies. This information can be represented by the matrix $B=(x~20)$

parts.questionText: Find, in terms of x, the matrix $T=BA$
Explain what the elements of the matrix T represent.

In the supermarket, the ingredients are sold in the following quantities:
1 pack of sugar (500g)
1 packet of butter (200g)
1 pack of chocolate (240g)
If Gwee buys 2 packets of sugar, find the largest integer value of x.
State the corresponding quantity of butter and chocolate required.

questions.title: Matrices Baking Ingredients

questions.stem: Write down the following numbers in ascending order.
questions.title: Ordering Numbers

parts.questionText: Simplify $\frac{12p^{2}q^{2}}{7r^{3}}\div\frac{3p^{5}r}{14q^{3}}$ giving your answer in positive index notation.

questions.stem: Tom requires a 7 year loan of $120 000 to purchase a new car. Bank M charges an interest of 4% per annum compounded monthly. Bank N charges a simple interest of 4.3% per annum.

parts.questionText: Determine which bank loan Tom should take. Justify your answer clearly.

questions.title: Loan Interest Comparison

parts.questionText: The cash price of a furniture set is $10 850. Kate buys the sofa on hire purchase. She pays a deposit of one fifth of the cash price. She then makes 24 monthly payments of $x. Given that the total amount that Kate pays for the furniture set is $11 578, find the value of x.

The exchange rate between Singapore dollars ($) and US dollars (USD) is $1= USD 0.74. The exchange rate between British pounds (£) and Singapore dollars ($) is £1=$1.72. Kate wants to buy a handbag. The same handbag costs USD 234 on online shopping platform A and £234 on online shopping platform B. By comparing the exchange rates, explain how you can tell that the handbag costs more on online shopping platform B.

questions.stem: (a) Point A is translated to point B by the vector $\binom{-5}{4}$. The position vector of point B is $\binom{3}{8}$.

parts.questionText: Find $|\vec{OA}|$.
P is a point that lies on AB and has coordinates (k, 10). Find the value of k.

OPQR is a quadrilateral. $\vec{OP}=3p$, $\vec{OR}=4r$ and $\vec{RQ}=7p+4r$. B is a point on PR such that $PB:BR=3:2$. (i) Write down $\vec{OQ}$ in terms of p and r. (ii) Write down $\vec{PQ}$ in terms of p and r. (iii) Write down $\vec{OB}$ in terms of p and r. (c) Explain why points O, B and Q are not collinear.

questions.title: Vectors

questions.stem: ABCD is a parallelogram and its diagonals intersect at point M. $\vec{AB}=\binom{8}{2}and\vec{AM}=\binom{2.5}{-2}.$ The coordinates of A are (0,4).

parts.questionText: Show that the position vector of C is $\binom{5}{0}.$
Find the coordinates of vertex D.
Find the length of diagonal BD.

questions.title: Parallelogram Vectors
